website_summaries.verdict: Great for smaller pieces and occasional hobby woodworking, this is a quality entry-level scroll saw.
pros: Users like the price and its ease of setup and use
Takes either pin or pinless blades
LED light is bright enough for most cutting work
cons: Switching blades can be a hassle
Vibrates heavily if not clamped down well to a sturdy surface
Sawdust doesn’t clear away as well as some users would like

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and despite what others have said, the blade changes and interior cuts weren't a ridiculous inconvenience. I have zero experience with scroll saws but after some YouTube videos and a couple practice scraps I had it down. The blade makes all the difference, a thinner blade is better for small cuts but is harder to control on straight stretches. It came with a few small blades and I was able to make a 16" bakery sign but I'd recommend getting a variety pack, I needed a thicker blade for this 4' name sign. I have zero complaints, this scroll saw is going to get a lot of use here!
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Solid base for exact work
customer_reviews.text: Waited until I used it for a while and I have to say I am very impressed! The solid aluminum base allows stable, an exactness and squareness of cut that cannot be achieved on a stamped metal base ( as found on the Central machine version). Over the last 6 months have been cutting everything from thin stock to 1.5 thick mesquite blocks ( which is a VERY hard wood!). Just finished a cutout in such a block, and the inside plug of wood fell right out! Absolute square cut I would expect from a metal cutting machine, not a jigsaw! Worth every penny and highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: El Capitan de Nube Escondido

customer_reviews.title: Don’t toss it
customer_reviews.text: In the packaging, there is a short round tube with a square base. On it is a sticker that reads it is for packaging and to discard. Don’t toss it. Wen includes a few tools that you need to hang on to (extra blade clamps, hex wrench,,,). Keep the tube thing, go to a local hardware store and find a plug that caps it off, put those spares and wrench into that tube stand, cap it off, and you have a storage place to find them later, when needed.
customer_reviews.author: John Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Looks better then it works.
customer_reviews.text: The air line becomes disconnected as soon as you begin a cut. I tried a tie wrap but it would not hold and I did not want to super glue it. The flexible light wiring became disconnected and the light stopped working. In order to fix, the cast iron assembly requires dismantling to access the wires. Not something I anticipated doing. The thin aluminum safety bar is flimsy at best and vibrates loose after turning the blade on. Other than those few things, it works okay.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Shargel

customer_reviews.title: Takes some practice
customer_reviews.text: As with all scroll saws, if you haven't used one before, practice on scrap before you ruin a quality piece. I've used scroll saws for years, last one was an old school Delta, that still works fine today. Wanted one that made blade change/replacement a lot easier. This el cheapo is worth every cent and a lot more. Definitely recommended for those that don't want to spend $400-500 for the good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: emr647

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, loud, unsteady, and terrible cutting capacity...
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different scroll saws over the years. I am not impressed at all by this WEN scrolls saw. Obviously, the price is alluring as well as some reviews, but at the end of the day you get what you pay for. It’s loud, it’s shaky, it doesn’t cut well, and it’s a cheap product. I have a personal feeling and opinion that many of these positive reviews are fake accounts. If I can get a refund or a return, I probably will take that roads.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Nasty vibrations
customer_reviews.text: Their is so much vibration, one would think how does it stay together. Skips around while making cut. The blade jumps all over the place. Maybe I got a bad one, I’ll never know.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This a a rock solid saw that has all the features I want on it, including a dust port to hook up to a shop vacuum, and a nice LED light to illuminate the workpiece. It also accepts both pinned blades and pin-less blades which many saws in this price range aren't capable of. I watched many reviews before pulling the plug on this one, and they all said this saw is the best value for the money you are ever going to get. I couldn't agree with them more.
customer_reviews.author: CJL

customer_reviews.title: Way over-rated
customer_reviews.text: Yet another product that is deceptively over rated. At just over $100 one can’t be too picky, but still, the saw is quite unpleasant to use. The vibration is very high. It has only three rubber feet, so stability is less than ideal. Take a look at the video, you can see how much it vibrates by how much the light shakes.
customer_reviews.author: CRPTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Broke Within First 10 Uses!
customer_reviews.text: The pin holding on the tensioning lever became loose and fell out within the first 10 uses of the tool. Without that pin, tension can NOT be added, meaning that the tool is 100% useless without a jury-rigged solution. I had to replace the pin with a nail just to get done what I needed to get done in the shop. I will be returning it for a better quality scroll-saw.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan R

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner scroll saw.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to cut pine for a pinewood derby car. I haven't had experience with a scroll saw before. This item was ready to go right out of the box and extremely intuitive. It cut as expected without problems. If you are looking for a scroll saw for small projects such as mine, this is a great scroll saw at a great price. If you are looking for a scroll saw for professional work, then read other reviews from more experienced users.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Brown

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This was a very inexpensive unit and it shows. It does work, it seems to stress when cutting 1/2" plywood. Lots of vibration even when mounted on a pad. It just feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: David Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: Cut above the rest
customer_reviews.text: Had a scroll saw years and years ago. This Wen 3921 variable saw works as advertised, and is the right replacement for the old Porter Cable I used to have. If you are starting out new on this saw, take some scrap material and practice. If you are a seasoned veteran with scroll saws, enjoy! The price for the 3921 beats the more expensive models with the same features.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Elson

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Saw
customer_reviews.text: This scroll saw did everything I needed it to do. Bought it to reproduce the switch panels for my boat using ABS plastic and it did not disappoint. Easy to use, no louder that you would expect and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D Galdo

customer_reviews.title: Jumpy, Noisy, Inaccurate, but functional
customer_reviews.text: This is my first scroll saw. I went for the more budget friendly option. I have not used a more expensive one, but this thing is very noisy, jumps around and requires a lot of practice before you can get it to do what you need for small items. I will be keeping it until it croaks out. But when it does, i will likely get a more expensive one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Machine
customer_reviews.text: Saw works well, like the dimmer switch feature my last one didn't have. Cuts well, a little hard to change the blades but after you do it a few times, not so bad. Like the small kit that comes with it and like the storage cover on the side. The blower blows hard enough to be able to see the line your cutting on. Seen reviews where they said it wasn't too good?? The light is very bright. The machine does vibrate a bit, but not real bad....all in all, like it, thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Definitely happy with this beginner's saw.
customer_reviews.text: I like this jigsaw. It's not industrial strength or quality but so far it's doing exactly what I got it for. I'm about three projects in with it and no problems at all (knock on wood). I have not mounted it down to a table top or board yet so the vibrations and bouncing are very noticeable. I do believe it will get much better once I secure it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Medin

customer_reviews.title: Poorly design blade holders
customer_reviews.text: Overall the saw is of good quality and a great price but it has a few issues. For the life of me I could not get the pin less blade holders to work. Wen provides 2 sets, the original and a improved set, blade holder and I tried both with no luck. I emailed Wen to see if there was a fix but no reply thus far. I returned the saw to Amazon today for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great when used with quality blades
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Some minor issues with dust collections and a little more vibration at high speed than I was expecting, but I also don't have it bolted down so that's probably on me. I primarily use slow speed anyway, so not a big deal for me. Put some decent blades on it (Olson are good and inexpensive) and this thing works like a champ, can't beat the value. Also, the issues with pinless blades are massively overhyped, they've switched from a hex screw to a wing nut and it couldn't be much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: I had a master woodworker recommend this product to me after he reviewed the stats of similar products that cost twice the price. This is absolutely the best bang for your buck. In addition, it’s a work of art. I have it on my countertop in my kitchen. Cons: I think it could have slightly more power. However, I am also cutting very tight corners with extremely dense wood so it could be my skill level. I would highly recommend this product to anyone both experts and beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for crafters.
customer_reviews.text: So far I enjoy this scroll saw, it is my first, and first power tool in general. It is easy to use and set up. I haven't had to clamp it or secure it down to a surface, the machine doesn't really move when using it so I didn't need to secure it down. I have been using mine to cut out seasonal shapes out of poplar board and it's been great.
customer_reviews.author: dianap95

customer_reviews.title: Nice starter scroll saw, perfect home shop tool
customer_reviews.text: High quality small scroll saw. Its not the equal of my 24" Delta but its 1/5 the price. Ive used it to cut 2" hardwood guitar body cavities and its up to the task. I bought this when I bought the 9" WEN bandsaw and I'm impressed by both tools.
customer_reviews.author: David W Miller

customer_reviews.title: A great piece of equipment for the occasional user.
customer_reviews.text: The WEN Scroll Saw. has surpassed my expectations for what I need. I am an occasional user and based on that need this saw is excellent. It is easy to use. I love the light. There are two cons: First, the spare blade holder could be better designed and second, it has to be clamped or bolted to a work surface to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Cornell

customer_reviews.title: Broken product
customer_reviews.text: Nice product but light was broken, called customers service department of company and only got voice mail. Left messages and no one has yet contacted me about issue. Bad customer service that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with pinless spiral blades
customer_reviews.text: Had high Hope's, seems a good product, if you only use pin type blades, extremely difficult to attach spiral pinless blades, which are all i use. The blades will not stay straight in the fastening devices for pinless blades that is provided, the devices for attaching the pinless blades, are not even attached to the saw. They hang on hooks, I guess if I had 7 inch long thin fingers, and could get the blades attached to the clips, it may work. I will be returning it as soon as I can this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Abrahams

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: liked that it was small for the bench top, easy to change blades, little on the light side, has to be anchored to keep it from sliding around, but overall it works great and does what it suppose to.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ogle

customer_reviews.title: Shakes!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing and I've done some interesting work with it. I do love the beginner-friendly use of it, however, it definitely SHAKES like crazy on some projects and on smaller items. It's definitely very easy to use though I wish I had better instructions on how to use it more. The blades are flimsy but they work perfect for thinner wood. I did just break one -.- but it comes with a back up blade so perfect! Definitely worth my money for a beginner like me! :D
customer_reviews.author: Ibtxhis Khang

customer_reviews.title: Very nice saw!
customer_reviews.text: I like my new saw very much. It is quite easy to mount saw blades. The saw was easy to set up as well. The instructions for the alternate saw blade mounts (jaws) were very unclear. All in all, this is a really good scroll saw and I can hardly wait to get busy with it.
customer_reviews.author: James howard

customer_reviews.title: First scroll saw
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to wood working but this has become one of my favorite toys. Not sure how it compares to others but this was really easy to use. Did break a few blades, but that's my fault. Still trying to get the right tension set.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas

customer_reviews.title: Safety features not so safe
customer_reviews.text: The safety bridge that holds down your wood keeps sliding down. It’s becoming difficult to operate and a bit of a safety issue. Other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Grace

customer_reviews.title: great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The saw itself was very easy to setup, The only difficulty was changing the blade holder from pinned to non pinned , I hard a difficult time getting it to cut correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Saw
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners...but would like a little more power. Even on high, seems to need more. It does cut good and is easy to operate, so other than the speed of cutting, very worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: JimChen

customer_reviews.title: Great value, would recommend to others
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Grand daughter, who used it extensively and I were quite pleased with the unit. Great addition to my workshop
customer_reviews.author: scott g boothe sr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, adjustable speed is nice, especially when first using.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used a scroll saw in years, found WEN saw easy to use and does a nice job for the small jobs I've done/to do. The only drawback I've found is that WEN doesn't have a stand for the saw. Since I have limited space, having a stand would be nice, if I had more room with a bench, then this would be non-issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not turn on
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked my saw and once it was plugged in and the switch was on it would not turn on. It smelt like something was burning. Definitely bummed.
customer_reviews.author: JFBuyer1

customer_reviews.title: Good Machine
customer_reviews.text: The machine vibrates when using and when making turns to cut out medium wood, it takes extra effort to make it stay in line with the markings. Any advice on what to do to make it cut better?
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: High quality product for a novice or professional.
customer_reviews.text: The saw is well built and I can now make plaques mostly for the160th night-stalkers. Which I had to purchase prior to buying my own machine.
customer_reviews.author: David N Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price
customer_reviews.text: First time scroll saw user love this machine does great work very cheap price excellent quality use it all the time making signs and wood projects. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blade attachements
customer_reviews.text: I am loving the scroll saw! Just wish there would have been more/better instructions for the use of pin-less blades. I have watched more videos on how to change to pin-less and getting tension right. Still fighting with that. This has been a learning lesson. I love the saw just wish it would have more info on what blades to use and when as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Evans

customer_reviews.title: Cool machine!
customer_reviews.text: First time touching a machine like this and I think my projects are coming out just fine still need more practice but the machine is really cool cants wait to keep doing more!!
customer_reviews.author: katherine

customer_reviews.title: blade angle
customer_reviews.text: blade is at an angle, no matter what adjust, I cannot set the saw to cut at a 90degree "straight" line.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Asher

customer_reviews.title: good budget scrollsaw
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 5 stars not because it's the best quality available, but because it was just what i was looking for. It works well and is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska dude

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great saw! Easy to use, easy blade change and perfect for beginners or experienced users.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Shakes Like Crazy. Complete Garbage Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my Second WEN Scroll saw. Its even worse than the 1st one Why does it shake violently?!?
customer_reviews.author: Greg Gabonay

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: You can find a better scroll saw without the price games.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the value
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent saw my first time using a scroll saw and felt very comfortable, the only thing I dont like is how hard it is to use painless blades.
customer_reviews.author: delereus

customer_reviews.title: Just like it says
customer_reviews.text: After you install the pinless attachment, pinless blade become fairly easy. The unit is well made. I left the compartment cover off for easier access to blade changing, otherwise it is great. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: GTary G.

customer_reviews.title: Christmas success
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas, and he opened it early. He usually never takes whatever I buy him out of the package, but he used this so much prior to Christmas making gifts for our grandchildren that I was afraid he would burn it up! It has been the best gift I've ever given him!
customer_reviews.author: melindamaloo

customer_reviews.title: Nice little hobby saw
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly right out of the box. I had a tiny little project to complete and all my power equipment was way too big. This fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: CosmoTopper53

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use and quiet. Connected it to my sweeper and could not hear it over the sweeper noise. I haven't tried changing blades yet but doesn't seem like it should be difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Gale Griswold

customer_reviews.title: Husband was looking for a better quality product
customer_reviews.text: Husband was not happy with quality. We returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recived a Non working unit 😞
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the deal is but I received a non working saw it won't power on won't do anything I'm very disappointed I needed it today
customer_reviews.author: Master D

customer_reviews.title: Super light duty machine, not for adults lol
customer_reviews.text: Shakes way too much. Blades dull very quickly. Buy a better machine.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Never had a scroll saw. I have been using this one for months. Works great, blades are easy to change out.
customer_reviews.author: thefuzz74

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: Good saw. I really like the price. Very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Knight

customer_reviews.title: YEP!
customer_reviews.text: Super nice! Very quiet considering its purpose. Light, easy to move around or bolt down. Has rubber feet so it doesnt slide around.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: This saw works great
customer_reviews.text: I have used this saw on oak & red cedar and it works great. Blade is easy to change and the saw is light & compact and easy to move to a shelf for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Karl K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Be sure to check for square out of the box, as mine was not squared, but easy to do. Otherwise, PERFECT! The shadow indicator and the LED light are a sweet bonus too!
customer_reviews.author: tonya

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it! Does everything he needs it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice! My grandson and I made a stroller for his sister's birthday. Then we made 4 toy tractor's from 2x6 birch lumber
customer_reviews.author: M. P.

customer_reviews.title: My first scroll saw......easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Works well on all my beginner projects
customer_reviews.author: RP West

customer_reviews.title: It’s nice machine
customer_reviews.text: What I liked was the size and how little noise it makes...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good saw for advanced scrollers
customer_reviews.text: Terrible set up for internal cuts. Blade holders are very time consuming and difficult to use. Ok for a beginner but not a good saw for more advanced strollers.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw is perfect for beginners. Cut this name out directly out of the box. I do wish switching from pinned to pinless blades was easier but I really enjoy the ease of switching pinned blades. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Karrie H.

customer_reviews.title: Great scroll saw
customer_reviews.text: Use this scroll saw all the time in my wood shop
customer_reviews.author: Dinny

customer_reviews.title: Clamp it down or bolt in place, front end will tip forward
customer_reviews.text: Good little scroll saw for the money. The light will vibrate away from your work area is my dislike. Ive secured mine to keep in place. Much better.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dennis

customer_reviews.title: You, not a tools
customer_reviews.text: Toy, not a tools. Hard follow the line. To slow in cut and made a lot of noise.
customer_reviews.author: dmitry koboy

customer_reviews.title: easy to use for novice user
customer_reviews.text: My husband always wanted one and he has practiced on it and enjoys it and the fact that is portable and easy to use. I can't wait to see what he makes for me!
customer_reviews.author: adkgirl

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I am able to get really fine cuts with this. Love it for a beginner like me. What I don’t like is the light, it bounces too much...otherwise a great saw.
customer_reviews.author: cilisk

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a friend
customer_reviews.text: Quieter than I expected. Easy to use. Have used it for several hours daily since I've gotten it. Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Marx-Miller-Balduf

customer_reviews.title: Good equipment at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Two things I take issue with. One, the light quit working after a couple hours of use. The second is that the tension handle is very thin metal. It bent the second time I switched blade types. It still functions fine, though. Minor areas for improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C. Birk

customer_reviews.title: Great for home project!
customer_reviews.text: Great sander for the money, start working with it right out of the box, FAST SHIPPING as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: We’re just getting started on this but so far we are really enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Really nice scroll saw for beginners like myself. Love using it it’s quiet and works good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mastenbrook Sr

customer_reviews.title: Works but hold down bracket is useless.
customer_reviews.text: The hold down bracket keeps rotating and binding up while you are sawing.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I love this saw.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Dremel scroll saws for fifty years...couldn't find a new one....so I went with this one..other than the table being a lil smaller there is really little difference. Am glad I saved money and bought this one!!
customer_reviews.author: Kat Nestell

customer_reviews.title: difficult to control tension and change blades
customer_reviews.text: seems that I have a lot to learn to make it work properly... difficult to control the cutting line.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Great new saw for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Best saw for beginners imo. Great price and is working great!
customer_reviews.author: N Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Well made
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a great deal.for the money. Works great easy to use. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad system. I like how easy it is to change blades, and how well designed it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Well made-easy to use very solid on the work bench!
customer_reviews.author: richard perron

customer_reviews.title: Product
customer_reviews.text: Not as strong what i aspect to be I use it once but just forgot to return it. The blades keep on break it up....:((
customer_reviews.author: Tra Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Table top Scroll saw
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be great, for what I do. It stows away, if need be. Easy to use, and cutting is great!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Not good for material over 1/2 inch
customer_reviews.text: Overall good for small crafts but anything over 1/2 inch thick and you will need something a bit stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I’ve had with this is the foot that holds the top of wood down on the table. I had to bend it to sit better, and the two legs weren’t touching simultaneously. An easy fix. The blower works fine, could be stronger, but it’s adequate.
customer_reviews.author: erclb

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scroll saw for the beginner. Wen has done a great job with this saw. I find myself using this a lot more than anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw
customer_reviews.text: I would give 5 stars if it came with a dust bag
customer_reviews.author: bobbys73

customer_reviews.title: Cutting edge !
customer_reviews.text: I have went crazy cutting out things! So easy to use too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not real powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Although I got the job done, this scroll saw is not for big, long term, or professional projects. At high speed it is not very fast. Even bolted down, it jitters. For young people it would be good and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Independent Professor

customer_reviews.title: intricate work
customer_reviews.text: like the ability to do intricate cuts. use for crafts
customer_reviews.author: Ardean Bakke

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Easy to get started, blade replacement is super easy. The light is nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline + Tyler Nissen

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to change blade for inside cuts!
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of cutting, but I had a really hard time with the blade for inside cuts. Removing part of the casing made it a bit better. Very disappointed over all
customer_reviews.author: Sandie Pollock

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and quiet
customer_reviews.text: It’s quiet and smooth running. Very easy to use. I used it to cut 1 inch thick birch plywood for a cam handle on a tablesaw fence.
customer_reviews.author: Tread

customer_reviews.title: Great product and excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Easy to use and had great ratings. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good at the price point
customer_reviews.text: I had concerns at the price point, but I've owned this saw for about 2 months and use it 2-3 hours a week, so far so good. I've been using it mostly for slow and maticulous cuts so the speed has never been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Guinness

customer_reviews.title: Nice to own a tool that will perform and last for years to come
customer_reviews.text: Runs great Inexpensive replacement blades Doesn't take much room Well built manly Great looking machine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look for rust when you unpack it.
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the box and the saw had rust on its base. Other than that it did the job of cutting my son’s pine wood derby car.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Will drive you crazy with its inaccurate cutting.
customer_reviews.text: Almost impossible to cut straight with this saw, no matter how you adjust the blade or how slow or fast you cut, it wanders off your line. I wish I'd used it before the window for return closed. I would have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Is this a return?
customer_reviews.text: Seem like a nice saw. But it came without any papers. No instructions, parts guide, one safety instructions. Makes me wonder if it was a return. Called Wen. They said they would mail me the info package. Now I am waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Collier

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. Making wood crafts with this scroll. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: C. Williams

product_meta.title: WEN 3921 16-inch Two-Direction Variable Speed Scroll Saw
product_meta.description: Style:With Flexible Worm LightRemember when your scroll saw could cut in two different directions? Take on the most intricate and artful cuts with the WEN 16-Inch Variable Speed Two-Direction Scroll Saw. The 9/16-inch stroke saws through hard woods up to two inches thick. Adjust the speed anywhere from 550 to 1600 strokes per minute with the simple turn of a knob. The cast iron base prevents vibration and walking during operation while the spacious 16-by-11-inch table bevels up to 45 degrees for angled cut. The adjustable air pump clears saw dust from your work area to give you a clear line of vision as you cut. This combined with the 1-1/2-inch dust port keep your work area clean so you can focus on your woodworking. The saw also includes a hold-down foot clamp for securing your project in place along with a flexible work light that bends and adjusts to whatever position your heart desires. This unique blade holder accepts both pinned and pinless blades while also allowing users to change the direction of their cut to accommodate their particular workpiece. For pinned blades, simply pop the pins out of the front holder and turn the blade 90 degrees. Now, your cuts are no longer confined by the 16-inch throat of the scroll saw. On top of that, our removable pinless blade holder design tightly grips blades to prevent them from coming loose during operation. Onboard blade and holder storage creates simple organization solutions between jobs. And because its a WEN product, your scroll saw comes backed by a two-year warranty, a nationwide network of skilled service technicians and a friendly customer help line, all to make sure you remember WEN.
feature_bullets: Unique design accepts blades in two directions (standard and 90 degrees) to allow for infinite ripping capacity
Variable speed goes from 400 to 1600 strokes per minute
Spacious 16-by-11-inch table bevels up to 45 degrees to the left for angled cuts
Cuts wood up to 2 inches thick with a 16-inch throat depth in the standard position
Features a thumb screw blade adapter for tool-free blade changes, a cast iron base, an air pump, a flex light, a dust port, a foot lock clamp, onboard storage, and three blades

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,666 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
